Based on your preferences, I would recommend "Creepshow". It is a cult classic horror film directed by George Landis and released in 1982.

The movie features five short stories from the comic book series of the same name. Each story follows a different character as they confront their deepest fears.

In "Creepshow", the actors provide excellent performances, especially Tim Matheson who plays the role of the vengeful husband.

Overall, "Creepshow" is an excellent horror film that is worth watching.

1. "The Evil Dead" (1981) directed by Sam Raimi and starring Betsy Baker, Betsy Baker, Ellen Sandweiss, Ellen Sandweiss, Ted Raimi, Ted Raimi, Bruce Campbell, Sam Raimi.

This classic horror film follows five friends who travel to a cabin in the woods, where they unknowingly release flesh-possessing demons. The group manages to defeat the demonic creatures, but with serious consequences that follow the group as they navigate their way through this terrifying world.

2. "Mama" (2013) directed by Iñácar Akelaar and starring Megan Charpentier, Isabelle Nélisse, Javier Botet.

This emotionally charged drama follows a young woman named Mama who has been living in a shelter with her adopted daughter since her husband killed their two children. As Mama grows older and her adopt daughter becomes more independent, Mama begins to question whether or not it was the right thing for her to have gotten pregnant at such a young age.
